column4: ok so, let me rephrase my question.... if i had been running gnome and then installed on the same machine kde4, and kde4 is running slowly, is there something i have to do with xserver or something so it will only run one at a time? i'm not sure whats going on, but i'm pretty sure it shouldnt be running this slowly
when you log back into gnome, does it run normally?
then most likely it's something with kde4. gnome doesn't run when you log into kde4  (ps -A in a a terminal tells you what's running) and I hear kde4 is not yet ready for prime time
